bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, WESTERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of Moy Chong for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
State of Washington, County of Pierce
Thomas Hawks being first duly sworn on his oath deposes and says:-

That he is and has been for a number of years last past a citizen and resident and freeholder of the City of Portland, Multnomah County, Oregon, and was for a number of years, deputy sheriff and a member of the police force of said city, and has for three years last past been deputy tax collector, engaged in the collection of taxec in said city; that he is well and personally acquainted with Moy Chong, who is a member of the firm of On Chong Wah, engaged in business at 140 Second Street, Corner of Alder in said City of Portland; that he saw the said Moy Chong when at Ta- coma, and that the said Moy Chong recognized this deponent and conversed with him; that the said Moy Chong can fairly speak the English language and can write some, and deponent further says that said Moy Chong, whose name is spelled in said certificate as Moy Chung, is by right and in fact Moy Chong, the letter u be- ing used in place of the letter o, and that he did depart in the spring of 1892 for China, and that he verily believes that he went for the sole purpose of visiting his friends and further aid- ing this business of the said firm to which he belongs, and he verily believes that the said Moy Chong is a good, respectable and bona fide Chinese merchant of the United States and he has known him for the last four years and he has been actively engaged in business at 140 Second Street; and this deponent is duly in- formed and verily believes that at this time said Moy Chung has an interest in and is a joint owner of said business, and that he is
an honest, upright and bona fide merchant of said city of Portland Oregon, as aforesaid, and has thus been informed by members of the said firm.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 7th day of June, 1893
Notary Public in and for Pierce County, Residing at Tacoma, Wash.
